Posts.Content: Dec 10, 2012 01:42PM Mary_123 wrote: "For patients treated with the combination of PD-991 plus letrozole, median PFS was 26.1 months," Wow, this is about equal to the median survival rate for MBC. It sounds like a huge progress.

Posts.Title: How Many Are We? DivineMrsM kt1966

Posts.Content: Jul 25, 2012 04:07PM Mary_123 wrote: At this point there no scientific evidence as to what the effect of surgery is on survival. I have heard two theories: 1. Take out the tumor, so that it does not constantly send cancer cells to the rest of the body 2. The tumor sends out mets but at the same time keeps them in check and when the primary tumor is removed, the mets start growing uncontrollably. No doctor has been able to tell me that one is better than the other, so I think it is all about how you feel about it and whether your status allows surgery.

Posts.Content: Sep 26, 2012 01:18PM Mary_123 wrote: Stagefree, Both grapefruit and green tea are supposed to interfere with Tamoxifen. My Tamoxifen bottle in fact has a warning on grapefruit from the pharmacy. The green tea info is from a meeting with a nutritionist.

Posts.Title: Taxotere / Carboplatin Experience Mary_123 Fitztwins

Posts.Content: Mary_123 wrote: I had a three-week infusion last week and to say that this combination knocked me down is an understatement. (stomach issues as a result of which I couldn't eat for four days, now muscle and joint  pain as a result of which I can barely walk, etc.) I was wondering whether this is normal for this dose and combination or whether I should look for the  culprit somewhere else - flue shot I had the day of the infusion, sashimi I ate a couple of days later, etc. I am also getting herceptin and perjeta.
